intro: Carphalea linearifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf carphalea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom during the wet season. Carphalea linearifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and riverbanks.
